alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:31PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Niobrara, northeastern Albany, northwestern Goshen, Platte and northeastern Converse Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 130 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bill to near Sibley Peak to 14 miles southwest of Westview Circle. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and cause impacts to high profile and lightweight vehicles. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Lusk, Guernsey, Fort Laramie, Glendo, Manville, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Sibley Peak, Bordeaux, Dull Center, Keeline, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Guernsey Campground, Rawhide Buttes, Lance Creek, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch, Two Moon Campground and Bill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
